April 2025 County of Marin EMS M 4
POISONS / DRUGS
Indications
Exposure to one or more toxic substances (ingestion, inhalation, or skin contact)
ALS RMC
• Consider contacting Poison Control Center at 1(800) 404-4646 for
additional information. If information from Poison Control is outside
of scope of practice, contact intended receiving facility for consult
• If LOC diminishes, protect airway
• If skin or eye exposure, decontaminate patient, remove clothing,
wash skin, continuous irrigation of eyes
Caustics/Corrosives Hydrocarbons or Phenothiazine reactions
Ingestion of substances Petroleum distillates Restlessness, muscle
causing intra-oral burns, Kerosene, gasoline, lighter spasms of the neck, jaw,
painful swallowing or fluid, furniture polish and back; oculogyric crisis,
inability to handle history of ingestion of
• Do not induce vomiting
secretions phenothiazine, or unknown
• Transport immediately
medication
Do not induce vomiting
Benadryl 50mg IV/IO
Insecticides
Organophosphates, carbonates; can cause Cyclic Antidepressants
cholinergic crisis characterized by bradycardia, Frequently associated with respiratory
increased salivation, lacrimation, sweating, depression, almost always tachycardic,
muscle fasciculation, abnormal cramping, widened QRS and ventricular arrhythmias
pinpoint pupils, incoherence or coma generally indicate life-threatening ingestions
• In the presence of life-threatening
• Atropine 2mg IV/IO slowly
dysrhythmias
• Repeat every 2-5 min until drying of
• Hyperventilate if assisting ventilations or
secretions, reversal of bronchospasm and
intubating
reversal of bradycardia
OR
• Sodium Bicarbonate 50mEq IV/IO
• consider use of the Duodote® if available
